main event: On October 7, 1968, a self-luminous object was observed by witnesses in Boone, North Carolina, moving slowly at a constant elevation before disappearing.
interesting points: The object periodically disappeared behind trees before reappearing., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes., Observers described the object as bright and larger than typical aircraft., Multiple witnesses, including an air force officer, reported the event., The object had no visible means of propulsion.
witness description: The witnesses included a local resident and an air force officer.
